alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Franklin; Henry; Montgomery; Patrick; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 3:53AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms increasing across the region. Showers and thunderstorms with heavy rainfall extend from southern Stokes and western Rockingham counties in northwest North Carolina through Patrick, Floyd and into Pulaski county in southwest Virginia. Rainfall rates are increasing in this activity. In addition, this rain is occurring over areas that have already seen over an inch of rain, in some cases just since midnight. Minor flooding is likely. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and Virginia, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Rockingham and Stokes. In Virginia, Carroll, Floyd, Franklin, Henry, Montgomery, Patrick and Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 745 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Anglin Branch, Big Beaver Island Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Ararat River, Belews Creek, Benaja Creek, Bassett Branch, Baker Branch and Archies Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Reidsville... Wentworth... Mayodan... Madison... Walnut Cove... Stuart... Stoneville... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
